t: Jeremiah 5
The Justice of God’s Judgment

“Run*pn to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem; See*ld now and know; And*ld seek in her open places If*ld you can find a man, If*ld there is anyone*i who executes judgment, Who*ld seeks the truth, And*ld I will pardon her.
Though*ld they say, ‘As*i the Lord*s lives,’ Surely*ld they swear falsely.”

O*ln Lord,*s are*i not Your eyes on the truth? You*ld have stricken them, But*ld they have not grieved; You*ld have consumed them, But*ld they have refused to receive correction. They*ld have made their faces harder than rock; They*ld have refused to return.
Therefore*ln I said, “Surely these are*i poor. They*ld are foolish; For*ld they do not know the way of the Lord,*s The*ld judgment of their God.
I*ld will go to the great men and speak to them, For*ld they have known the way of the Lord,*s The*ld judgment of their God.” But*ln these have altogether broken the yoke And*ild burst the bonds.

Therefore*ld a lion from the forest shall slay them, A*ld wolf of the deserts shall destroy them; A*ld leopard will watch over their cities. Everyone*ld who goes out from there shall be torn in pieces, Because*ld their transgressions are many; Their*ld backslidings have increased.

“How*ln shall I pardon you for this? Your*ld children have forsaken Me And*ld sworn by those*i that are not gods. When*ld I had fed them to the full, Then*ld they committed adultery And*ld assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
They*ld were like*i well-fed lusty stallions; Every*ld one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
Shall*ld I not punish them*i for these things?”*i says the Lord.*s “And*ld shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?
“Go*ln up on her walls and destroy, But*ld do not make a complete end. Take*ld away her branches, For*ld they are*i not the Lord*s ’s.
For*ld the house of Israel and the house of Judah Have*ld dealt very treacherously with Me,” says the Lord.*s
They*ln have lied about the Lord,*s And*ld said, “It*i is*i not He. Neither*ld will evil come upon us, Nor*ld shall we see sword or famine.
And*ld the prophets become wind, For*ld the word is*i not in them. Thus*ld shall it be done to them.”
Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s God of hosts: “Because*pn you speak this word, Behold,*ld I will make My words in your mouth fire, And*ld this people wood, And*ld it shall devour them.

Behold,*ld I will bring a nation against you from afar, O*ld house of Israel,” says the Lord.*s “It*ld is*i a mighty nation, It*ld is*i an ancient nation, A*ld nation whose language you do not know, Nor*ld can you understand what they say.
Their*ld quiver is*i like an open tomb; They*ld are*i all mighty men.

And*ld they shall eat up your harvest and your bread, Which*ild your sons and daughters should eat. They*ld shall eat up your flocks and your herds; They*ld shall eat up your vines and your fig trees; They*ld shall destroy your fortified cities, In*ld which you trust, with the sword.
“Nevertheless*p in those days,” says the Lord,*s “I will not make a complete end of you.

And it will be when you say, ‘Why does the Lord*s our God do all these things*i to us?’ then you shall answer them, ‘Just as you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so you shall serve aliens in a land that*i is*i not yours.’
“Declare*pn this in the house of Jacob And*ld proclaim it in Judah, saying,
‘Hear*ld this now, O foolish people, Without*ld understanding, Who*ld have eyes and see not, And*ld who have ears and hear not:

Do*ld you not fear Me?’ says the Lord.*s ‘Will*ld you not tremble at My presence, Who*ld have placed the sand as the bound of the sea, By*ld a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass beyond it? And*ld though its waves toss to and fro, Yet*ld they cannot prevail; Though*ld they roar, yet they cannot pass over it.
But*ld this people has a defiant and rebellious heart; They*ld have revolted and departed.
They*ld do not say in their heart, “Let*ld us now fear the Lord*s our God, Who*ld gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season. He*ld reserves for us the appointed weeks of the harvest.”
Your*ld iniquities have turned these things*i away, And*ld your sins have withheld good from you.
‘For*ln among My people are found wicked men;*i They*ld lie in wait as one who sets snares; They*ld set a trap; They*ld catch men.
As*ld a cage is full of birds, So*ld their houses are*i full of deceit. Therefore*ld they have become great and grown rich.

They*ld have grown fat, they are sleek; Yes,*ld they surpass the deeds of the wicked; They*ld do not plead the cause, The*ld cause of the fatherless; Yet*ld they prosper, And*ld the right of the needy they do not defend.
Shall*ld I not punish them*i for these things?’*i says the Lord.*s ‘Shall*ld I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?’
“An*ln astonishing and horrible thing Has*ld been committed in the land:
The*ld prophets prophesy falsely, And*ld the priests rule by their own*i power; And*ld My people love to*i have*i it*i so. But*ld what will you do in the end?
